definition: A law that allows citizens to request information from public authorities within set timelines.
A legal action filed in a court of law for the protection of public interest, not just personal grievances.
A written document prepared by police when they receive information about the commission of a cognizable offense.
The process of addressing complaints and resolving issues raised by citizens regarding public services.
An independent official appointed to investigate complaints against public authorities.
A set of guidelines issued by the Election Commission to regulate political parties and candidates during elections.
An independent examination of government accounts and performance to ensure transparency and accountability.
A public declaration by a government agency of its service standards and timelines for delivery.
